10.54.text: The lights are up as Bristol gleams

12.36.text: and feels the festive spirit breathe

14.96.text: Crispy leaves are squished by feet

19.70.text: From way up high on Clifton's peak

24.84.text: The Christmas buzz of busy bees

28.26.text: Running round with lists of things

29.78.text: as 'Do they know it's Christmas?' rings

31.78.text: At night when stars are twinkly

35.30.text:
each time excited kids will
be

39.40.text: it's eight more, seven more, six more sleeps

44.86.text: it means a lot of different things

49.35.text: a break from those revision weeks

54.52.text: For others it's the mixed cuisines

58.74.text: Those silly themes over chilly feet and

63.12.text: Around the tree we passed presents

68.30.text: We pine after new and hope the list

72.72.text: just like we did last year

76.48.text: not just the angel's cedar top

79.49.text: no one does this year round

82.64.text: there's enough to fill our boots

87.78.text: All it takes is a tree

88.92.text: to take us back to our roots

90.92.text: As students head home for Christmas Eve

93.16.text: And Bristol sleeps with wishful dreams

95.56.text: We realise the real gifts we see

97.41.text: Aren't just beneath a Christmas tree.
